```{r}
install.packages("ggplot2")
```

```{r}
# Load necessary library
library(ggplot2)

# Set seed for reproducibility
set.seed(42)

# Number of days
days <- 100

# Simulate data
data <- data.frame(
  Day = 1:days,
  Matt = rnorm(days, mean = 50, sd = 20),
  Ash = rnorm(days, mean = 75, sd = 20),
  Jacki = rnorm(days, mean = 60, sd = 20),
  Rol = rnorm(days, mean = 40, sd = 20),
  Mike = rnorm(days, mean = 70, sd = 20)
)

# View the first few rows of the simulated data
head(data)
```
```{r}
install.packages("car")
install.packages("tseries")
```

```{r}
# 1. T-test for mean comparison between two undergraduates (e.g., Matt vs. Ash)
t.test(data$Matt, data$Ash)

# 2. Test for variance equality (Levene's Test)
library(car)
leveneTest(data$Matt, data$Ash)

# 3. ANOVA to test if the overall mean is the same for all undergraduates
aov_result <- aov(Day ~ Matt + Ash + Jacki + Rol + Mike, data = data)
summary(aov_result)

# 4. Test for a trend over time (e.g., for Matt)
model <- lm(Matt ~ Day, data = data)
summary(model)

# 5. Run test for randomness (e.g., Runs test for Matt)
library(tseries)
runs.test(as.factor(data$Matt > mean(data$Matt)))

```
